channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Multi-Task Benchmark for Korean Legal Language Understanding and Judgement Prediction
item.description: Here we present the first large-scale benchmark of Korean legal AI datasets, LBox Open, that consists of one legal corpus, two classification tasks, two legal judgement prediction (LJP) tasks, and one summarization task.

item.title: Unsupervised Foggy Scene Understanding via Self Spatial-Temporal Label Diffusion
item.description: Specifically, based on the two discoveries of local spatial similarity and adjacent temporal correspondence of the sequential image data, we propose a novel Target-Domain driven pseudo label Diffusion (TDo-Dif) scheme.

item.title: Interactively Learning Preference Constraints in Linear Bandits
item.description: We provide an instance-dependent lower bound for constrained linear best-arm identification and show that ACOL's sample complexity matches the lower bound in the worst-case.

item.title: Refining neural network predictions using background knowledge
item.description: Using a new algorithm, we combine refinement functions to find refined predictions for logical formulas of any complexity.

item.title: Ask to Know More: Generating Counterfactual Explanations for Fake Claims
item.description: In this paper, we propose elucidating fact checking predictions using counterfactual explanations to help people understand why a specific piece of news was identified as fake.

item.title: Mixed integer linear optimization formulations for learning optimal binary classification trees
item.description: An optimal binary classification tree can be obtained by solving a biobjective optimization problem that seeks to (i) maximize the number of correctly classified datapoints and (ii) minimize the number of branching vertices.

item.title: Meta Optimal Transport
item.description: We study the use of amortized optimization to predict optimal transport (OT) maps from the input measures, which we call Meta OT.

item.title: Neural Template: Topology-aware Reconstruction and Disentangled Generation of 3D Meshes
item.description: This paper introduces a novel framework called DTNet for 3D mesh reconstruction and generation via Disentangled Topology.

item.title: Diffeomorphic Counterfactuals with Generative Models
item.description: Counterfactuals can explain classification decisions of neural networks in a human interpretable way.

item.title: Borrowing or Codeswitching? Annotating for Finer-Grained Distinctions in Language Mixing
item.description: We present a new corpus of Twitter data annotated for codeswitching and borrowing between Spanish and English.

item.title: Adversarial Counterfactual Environment Model Learning
item.description: Since the target policies can be various and unknown in policy learning, we propose an adversarial CQRM objective in which the model learns on counterfactual data queried by adversarial policies, and finally derive a tractable solution GALILEO.

item.title: RuCoCo: a new Russian corpus with coreference annotation
item.description: We present a new corpus with coreference annotation, Russian Coreference Corpus (RuCoCo).

item.title: Merak: A Efficient Distributed DNN Training Framework with Automated 3D Parallelism for Giant Foundation Models
item.description: These features make it necessary to apply 3D parallelism, which integrates data parallelism, pipeline model parallelism and tensor model parallelism, to achieve high training efficiency.

item.title: Referring Image Matting
item.description: Image matting refers to extracting the accurate foregrounds in the image.

item.title: Learning the Space of Deep Models
item.description: In particular, we show that it is possible to use representation learning to learn a fixed-size, low-dimensional embedding space of trained deep models and that such space can be explored by interpolation or optimization to attain ready-to-use models.

item.title: Scalable Deep Gaussian Markov Random Fields for General Graphs
item.description: We propose a flexible GMRF model for general graphs built on the multi-layer structure of Deep GMRFs, originally proposed for lattice graphs only.

item.title: Lightweight Conditional Model Extrapolation for Streaming Data under Class-Prior Shift
item.description: We introduce LIMES, a new method for learning with non-stationary streaming data, inspired by the recent success of meta-learning.

item.title: Neural Prompt Search
item.description: The size of vision models has grown exponentially over the last few years, especially after the emergence of Vision Transformer.

item.title: Structure-consistent Restoration Network for Cataract Fundus Image Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, to circumvent the strict deployment requirement, a structure-consistent restoration network (SCR-Net) for cataract fundus images is developed from synthesized data that shares an identical structure.

item.title: Analytical Composition of Differential Privacy via the Edgeworth Accountant
item.description: Many modern machine learning algorithms are composed of simple private algorithms; thus, an increasingly important problem is to efficiently compute the overall privacy loss under composition.

item.title: CLIP-Actor: Text-Driven Recommendation and Stylization for Animating Human Meshes
item.description: CLIP-Actor animates a 3D human mesh to conform to a text prompt by recommending a motion sequence and learning mesh style attributes.

item.title: Xplique: A Deep Learning Explainability Toolbox
item.description: Today's most advanced machine-learning models are hardly scrutable.

item.title: Uncovering bias in the PlantVillage dataset
item.description: We report our investigation on the use of the popular PlantVillage dataset for training deep learning based plant disease detection models.

item.title: Unlearning Protected User Attributes in Recommendations with Adversarial Training
item.description: We conduct experiments on the MovieLens-1M and LFM-2b-DemoBias datasets, and evaluate the effectiveness of the bias mitigation method based on the inability of external attackers in revealing the users' gender information from the model.

item.title: Local Spatiotemporal Representation Learning for Longitudinally-consistent Neuroimage Analysis
item.description: Recent self-supervised advances in medical computer vision exploit global and local anatomical self-similarity for pretraining prior to downstream tasks such as segmentation.

item.title: STIP: A SpatioTemporal Information-Preserving and Perception-Augmented Model for High-Resolution Video Prediction
item.description: To solve the information loss problem, the proposed model aims to preserve the spatiotemporal information for videos during the feature extraction and the state transitions, respectively.

item.title: Towards Layer-wise Image Vectorization
item.description: Image rasterization is a mature technique in computer graphics, while image vectorization, the reverse path of rasterization, remains a major challenge.

item.title: Distillation Decision Tree
item.description: With well-known advantages in interpretation, decision tree is a competitive candidate of the transparent model.

item.title: BigVGAN: A Universal Neural Vocoder with Large-Scale Training
item.description: Despite recent progress in generative adversarial network(GAN)-based vocoders, where the model generates raw waveform conditioned on mel spectrogram, it is still challenging to synthesize high-fidelity audio for numerous speakers across varied recording environments.

item.title: DiSparse: Disentangled Sparsification for Multitask Model Compression
item.description: We analyzed the pruning masks generated with DiSparse and observed strikingly similar sparse network architecture identified by each task even before the training starts.

item.title: Joint Entropy Search For Maximally-Informed Bayesian Optimization
item.description: As a light-weight approach with superior results, JES provides a new go-to acquisition function for Bayesian optimization.

item.title: An Empirical Study on Disentanglement of Negative-free Contrastive Learning
item.description: With the proposed metric, we benchmark the disentanglement property of negative-free contrastive learning for the first time, on both popular synthetic datasets and a real-world dataset CelebA.

item.title: SimVP: Simpler yet Better Video Prediction
item.description: From CNN, RNN, to ViT, we have witnessed remarkable advancements in video prediction, incorporating auxiliary inputs, elaborate neural architectures, and sophisticated training strategies.

item.title: Comprehensive Fair Meta-learned Recommender System
item.description: The core idea is to learn global shared meta-initialization parameters for all users and rapidly adapt them into local parameters for each user respectively.

item.title: VideoINR: Learning Video Implicit Neural Representation for Continuous Space-Time Super-Resolution
item.description: The learned implicit neural representation can be decoded to videos of arbitrary spatial resolution and frame rate.

item.title: Challenges and Opportunities in Offline Reinforcement Learning from Visual Observations
item.description: Offline reinforcement learning has shown great promise in leveraging large pre-collected datasets for policy learning, allowing agents to forgo often-expensive online data collection.

item.title: A Two-Ball Esllberg Paradox: Experimental Evidence
item.description: We conduct an incentivized experiment on a nationally representative US sample (N=708) to test how people prefer to avoid ambiguity even when the ambiguity improves the probability of receiving a fixed price.

item.title: Learning to generalize Dispatching rules on the Job Shop Scheduling
item.description: Current models on the JSP do not focus on generalization, although, as we show in this work, this is key to learning better heuristics on the problem.

item.title: Neo-GNNs: Neighborhood Overlap-aware Graph Neural Networks for Link Prediction
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have been widely applied to various fields for learning over graph-structured data.

item.title: A Relational Intervention Approach for Unsupervised Dynamics Generalization in Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: However, because environments are not labelled, the extracted information inevitably contains redundant information unrelated to the dynamics in transition segments and thus fails to maintain a crucial property of $Z$: $Z$ should be similar in the same environment and dissimilar in different ones.

item.title: PointNeXt: Revisiting PointNet++ with Improved Training and Scaling Strategies
item.description: In this work, we revisit the classical PointNet++ through a systematic study of model training and scaling strategies, and offer two major contributions.

item.title: A Spectral Representation of Kernel Stein Discrepancy with Application to Goodness-of-Fit Tests for Measures on Infinite Dimensional Hilbert Spaces
item.description: It is often employed in the scenario where a user has a collection of samples from a candidate probability measure and wishes to compare them against a specified target probability measure.

item.title: Language Identification for Austronesian Languages
item.description: This paper provides language identification models for low- and under-resourced languages in the Pacific region with a focus on previously unavailable Austronesian languages.

item.title: VITA: Video Instance Segmentation via Object Token Association
item.description: Specifically, we use an image object detector as a means of distilling object-specific contexts into object tokens.

item.title: Efficient and Robust 2D-to-BEV Representation Learning via Geometry-guided Kernel Transformer
item.description: GKT leverages the geometric priors to guide the transformer to focus on discriminative regions and unfolds kernel features to generate BEV representation.

item.title: Graph Attention Multi-Layer Perceptron
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have achieved great success in many graph-based applications.

item.title: AGConv: Adaptive Graph Convolution on 3D Point Clouds
item.description: In this paper, we propose Adaptive Graph Convolution (AGConv) for wide applications of point cloud analysis.

item.title: Convolutional Dictionary Learning by End-To-End Training of Iterative Neural Networks
item.description: Sparsity-based methods have a long history in the field of signal processing and have been successfully applied to various image reconstruction problems.

item.title: A Critical Review on the Use (and Misuse) of Differential Privacy in Machine Learning
item.description: We review the use of differential privacy (DP) for privacy protection in machine learning (ML).

item.title: SwinCheX: Multi-label classification on chest X-ray images with transformers
item.description: Our model has been tested with several number of MLP layers for the head setting, each achieves a competitive AUC score on all classes.
